name: Amy Ruth's
address: 113 W 116th St, New York, NY 10026, USA

reviews.text:
M - The service is warm, the food is tasty, this was a beautiful entry into â€œsoul foodâ€ for me.

J - Feel like this place had so much potential but there wasnâ€™t much meat on my ribs and the mac and cheese was lumpy

Look. I couldnâ€™t finish it, so much food.
And it was goooood.
The Mac & cheese is spot on.
The corn bread is wonderful.
Cheesy grits hit the spot.
And I had the salmon croquettes were really good.

Would eat here again.
Strongly recommend dining here.

Service was a little slow and they did not acknowledge our birthdays although they were notified in advance and while we we were there. Two other birthdays were acknowledged. Cocktails were good. The chicken (chicken and waffles) was dry.

Only had an hour for lunch, and waiters were already busy. Sat down, no water,  no cornbread, no waiter. Decided to order our food at the counter. The lady at the register totally understood the short time we had. Liz Marie, I hope I'm spelling your name right. She is AWESOME!!! Not only did she leave the register to bring our food to the table, she came back with our water, cornbread and extra gravy for those mashed potatoes. Got our delicious food, and excellent service from Lizmarie before our waiter even came to our table. Give that lady a raise! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

My mother wanted to take me out to dinner at a restaurant and this is where she chose and Iâ€™m so glad she did. I had a wonderful time. The food was amazing.  I ordered the ribs and chicken combo and I had two sides which were peas and rice  and potato salad, which was amazing the cornbread they provided was amazing. I tasted my mothers  food she had chicken and waffles. Amazing. The staff was  welcoming The establishment was very clean. I would definitely recommend . Itâ€™s a staple in the community  and  defines â€œSoul Foodâ€  at its best
the food is fabulous. fried chicken, smothered pork chops, mac & cheese, collared greens, cheesy grits, potato salad. all were genuinely devine ğŸ˜€â€¦

I expected there to be a long line and wait to be seated since it was a beautiful Sunday afternoon. However, I was seated and served on quickly. The wait staff was quick and the head person in charge, Charlemagne ran a very friendly courtesy but most importantly effective operation.

The food came out quickly and was hot, plentiful and tasty. Can't wait to eat my leftovers!
I love us! This place is filled with paintings of our people who have filled our lives with love through music, art and politics. The food is amazing, with large proportions! The fish & grits is A1!

Harlem staple right here.  Had some of the best meatloaf and mashed potatoes everâ€¦perfect comfort food on a chilly day.  still thinking about it.  Casual, clean, friendlyâ€¦in the heart of Harlem.  Highly recommend.
Chicken waffles with mashed potatoes and gravy - killed it!

absolutely delicious. this is authentic soul food and all the flavors are on point. i really loved the collard greens and mac and cheese. yams are on point as well. the fried chicken was delicious and the banana pudding was light and not too sweet.

The setting here has character without trying too hard. Quality food elements, good flavor combinations, fair costs, and nice staff. He had a great attitude and made our first time visit to the Amy Ruth's totally enjoyable. Each taste proves the point better than words. All components deserved praise & I want to come back soon!

I thoroughly enjoyed everything served!  Our group was served great cornbread and the food tasted amazing!   On top of the good food, it was brought out very quickly. One thing is to leave a pitcher of water as we wanted more water than served but otherwise it was a great experience in a friendly atmosphere!

The atmosphere is lacking, but the food is good. It used to be great, and now lack consistency. The service leaves something to be desired.
I come for the smothered chicken, but I don't go as often due to the increased prices and decreased service.

No lo recomiendo en absoluto. Ã‰ramos 5 y como no pedimos un plato para cada uno, ya que entre otras cosas, Ã­bamos con una niÃ±a pequeÃ±a, la camarera considerÃ³ que pedimos muy poco y nos lo hizo saber con desprecio.
A partir de ese momento, ni siquiera nos trajeron el bizcocho de cortesÃ­a que todas las mesas tenÃ­a.
Nos hizo sentir muy incÃ³modos hasta que nos fuimos.
The food was extremely salty my Goodness.
Horrible food, rude people.
Love it...

Yesterday my friends and I dine at Amy Ruthâ€™s. When I tell you that I had the best turkey wings I have ever eaten, I did. The potions of food were very satisfying. To top it off our waitress Latasha was top notch. If you visit New York, put this on your restaurant to go list. Request Latasha to be your waitress, tell her the ladies from Cleveland sent you.
The culture of the restaurant was great. They need a little pick me up modern style, keeping the history as a priority. The fish was good, a little saltyğŸ§‚. Drink lots of water, you'll be fine.

This place never disappoints visitors. Adding to the positives, the workers showed kindness and adaptability. The meals offer excellent taste and leave you content. The ambiance works well, everything's spotless, and the design is simple. This restaurant is worth visiting at least once.
Pollo increible! merece mucho la pena.

The setting here makes ordinary meals feel special. Their kitchen times cooking perfectly. Staff members consistently create personal connections. Staff showed care, our order came fast, and each dish was properly prepared. I'm set on coming back to this place.

Si si pollo con gofres ! Has leÃ­do bien esa es la especialidad ...y te adelanto que estÃ¡n brutales, ha sido el mejor desayuno que he tenido ...el cafÃ© no tan bueno (aguachirri) la atenciÃ³n buena y rÃ¡pida.

No admiten cuentas separadas sin vas en grupo
I was there in August I had fried and smother porkchop  Gabriel Union favorite dish with potato salad, so delicious.

Very good food and service
Happy pre birthday brunch Kenny
Waffles are literally perfec waffles
Food was awful. I'm serious.

Their beef ribs were delightful. Soft and tender. I only tried a piece but my goodness. And their pineapple coconut cake soft and delicious. I ordered fried chicken. This was my second time back but tried something different. Consistently good and friendly people. Thank you.
Fried chicken is very good. Highly recommended!

This place is not one my favorite places to be anymore.

I order the chicken and waffle and the  waffle was horrible. I couldnâ€™t eat it.

I showed the male waiter, who is sweet by the way the waffle and how itâ€™s wasnâ€™t good to taste and I asked if they can adjust the price since I already ate the fried chicken.

Manager basically said it cannot work and this was order after 8PM.

The waiter was great but the manager is horrible for not understanding what was served to me.

I will not offer my money and time ever again.

No stars
The catfish is top notch!!!!!!!
Great reputation, but sort of a tourist trap vibe.  Overpriced, slow service, better than average food.  Probably one and done.

This was my second time here and I am sad to say the food is not the same. The catfish was yellow and just didnâ€™t look good Mac and cheese was  dry and the cheese didnâ€™t seem melted. The whiting was salty rice dry. The cornbread was good.
However our server was very pleasant and gave good customer service. She asked how the food was and we told her. She took the food off our bill. Sad to say we left there hungry. Wasted trip from Long Island to the city.
Delicious
Good food, good packaging, good portions. Worth the price. I would recommend for anyone wanting to try soul food in the area.

I got chicken and waffles delivered after a long shift and it was DELICIOUS! The chicken came in a crisper bag so it stayed crispy. The waffle was soft and flavorful. I used my own syrup but this hit the spot I am so impressed. So many disappointing chicken and waffles in this cityâ€¦.Thanks for saving me Amy Ruth!

The high marks are well-deserved. The staff also did an excellent job. This spot is truly noteworthy!!! The portions exceed expectations and the employees care. You get fair exchange for your dollars.
No matter what ANYONE else says!!! The food is ğŸ’‹
Authentic food in the Harlems heart. Very good option to go after church.

Un lieu culte oÃ¹ les waffles sont incroyables.
Les portions ne sont plus gargantuesques comme il y a 10 ans et câ€™est trÃ¨s bien ainsi! Câ€™est toujours bon et les serveurs trÃ¨s sympas

My mom and Best friend ate at the restaurant.  The food was terrible. The food was cold. The sides taste like it came out the cans. The rib was under cook, fish was smelly. Even a group across from us did not eat their food. The mango drink was good but was about $7. The murals was nice but other that uggg. Also kinda rush us and nobody else was sitting  hardly in there. Now back in the day it was good. Please bring back the cooks from Gordon Alabama!!!!!
It was a nice atmosphere, the music and food was great!! Will surely go again.

My cousins and I went here for lunch and I canâ€™t wait to get back to NY so I can get some
More of that good food. Iâ€™m from Fort. Lauderdale Florida so it was nice to get some good soul food.
I used to love the pineapple coconut cake!

Extremely generous portions and very delicious.  I have switched over to Amy Ruth's for my regular Sunday catfish dinner just because you get 30-40% more for 10% less price.  The food is hot and delicious too.
They had amazing music and drinks. Courtney our server was very attentive for our food and drinks! Definitely recommend for a date night or a birthday outing.

Revised review: We ate here once again last night and this is probably our last time.  They used to have amazing fried chicken and sides, but the quality has gone downhill traumatically.  Our chicken was served to us cold on the inside, oh, it was cooked â€“ but obviously put somewhere on the side and in a vain attempt to reheat it was made.  The only diet beverage you're gonna find there is Diet Pepsi and water, they always seem to be out of unsweetened iced tea â€“ which is really bad if you're diabetic on a keto diet and sought out fried chicken as a meal.    Although our waitress apologized for the cold chicken, This was the third bad experience in a row at Amy Ruthâ€™s.  We're sorry to say we have now written it off and is unredeemable.  The dining room is a loud echo chamber of flickering lights.
Great food , large portions

i had the fried chicken wings omg the best fried chicken crispy well seasoned everyone enjoyed their food it was amazing cornbread hot delicious the mac cheese the cabbage everything was great we will definitely be back soon

My 1st visit, found them searching black owned restaurants in NYC. They appeared to be closed from outside bc it was dark & we almost left.  So glad we came in.  The younger man & older man whom we spoke to upon entering were a little rude & we were thinking about leaving but glad we didn't.  The guy that brought out complimentary corn bread & water was nice.  Our waitress Charmaine was great, good energy,  nice & friendly. Let me tell y'all about this food... this food made up for any negative vibe I had at 1st.  Complimentary cornbread was so good.  I had fried shrimp, string beans & mashed potatoes w gravy.  This was so delicious, my family members had barbecue ribs,  shrimp & grits,  meatloaf.  The portion size is enough for 2 people. We ordered desserts to go,  sweet potato pie, peach cobbler, pineapple coconut cake & double chocolate cake, these were huge portions also. Everyone really enjoyed their food so much we're thinking about coming back to NY from MD at least once per year just to patronize this establishment. That's how good the food was.

The fried chicken was stupendously good. Crispy outside and soft inside. The ribs were very good too. The corn bread was fantastic. The walls are plastered with famous black icons. A bit dark inside though and could use a little more lighting.

We got cornbread on the house (super yummy). We got the OBAMA (chicken), fried catfish, and pork ribs. Can't go wrong with either but I was expecting more chicken. Entree (not waffle dish) came with 2 sides. As y'all can see, they're plentiful.
I also love the athmosphere and the paintings are great!

Some of the best tasting food Iâ€™ve had in a while. I loved everything from the food to the walls filled with icons. It wasnâ€™t fancy, just straight up soul food. Big portions, great service, great food. I never leave reviews but hours later Iâ€™m still thinking about how good it is!! Even my leftovers held up!

The Tommy Tomita, fried chicken wings on a waffle was pretty unique and tasty when ate them with maple syrup.  But the core value of this restaurant was warm atmosphere filled with friendliness of people (both staff and customers).
I felt as if I had a glimpse of Harlem culture through the short lunch time.

I have been eating at Amy Ruth's for over 20 years. It is a classic part of my routine New York City experience. Every time I am in the city, I stop here for some classic soul food. ALWAYS!

Food:
I am a creature of habit, so I always get the President Obama special - fried chicken with macaroni and cheese, and collard greens. Sometimes, I'll add potato salad and usually treat myself to banana pudding. The banana pudding is deadly, no sinful.

Location:
It is in the heart of Harlem (uptown) on 116th and Malcolm X Blvd. Short walk from the 2/3 (green line Express) trains. If you're driving, there's usually plenty of parking on Malcolm X Blvd.

Dining Options:
Over the years, the inside dining has changed. Where takeout is now located used to have dine-in tables, but that all changed years ago. They also used to have upstairs dining, although I don't think that's no longer an option. If you get seated on the left side of the restaurant and there's small children there, BEWARE!! There is an echo on that part of the restaurant, so fussy children yelling and/or screaming can easily become unbearable if you're trying to enjoy your meal with some sort of peace. Its like they have a microphone.

Restaurant:
The restaurant is one big artistic mural full of many popular and renowned black artists, mostly performers, but some politicians.

Menu:
The menu is broken down in homage to some of the black community's greats. For example: Barack Obama's name is how they identify the fried chicken dinner.

Amenities:
I am funny about public restrooms. I typically never use them, holding my bladder until I can get to a restroom that I trust and know (preferably at home), but the bathrooms here are always kept very clean. I usually stop here on my way back home from NYC, so I stop in the bathroom to freshen up before the long drive back. Now, its an old Harlem building, so keep that in mind, but you can expect a very well stocked and cleaned bathroom experience.

Competition:
I don't fool with the other soul food restaurants in Harlem. No, ma'am. Only Amy Ruth's. Its been tried-and-true since Day 1. I love this place and the staple waitresses who have been working here for years. If you want good soul food, go to Amy Ruth's.

It pains me to give such a low score. Iâ€™ve eaten here before and it was fantastic (~1 year ago). Today, however, it was a huge disappointment. Something has changed here. This place used to have amazing soulful Mac and cheese. Today, I was served a brick of dry, cold, flavorless velveeta and pasta. The salmon croquettes were good, the cornbread was good, chicken and waffles were good, collard greens were good. But if a soul food place canâ€™t make decent mac and cheese, thatâ€™s a problem.

Slop food. Being a Southern bell, I lean into finding soul food places serving up traditional soulful delicacies as it reminds me of home. I ordered this plate of meatloaf with fried okra and I was utterly disgusted in the quality. I ended up throwing it in the trash. Meatloaf is supposed to be made with real ground beef. Instead, the meatloaf was made with artificial processed meat, similar to what you find in McDonald's and White Castle burgers. I've ordered the fried chicken wings plate and the wings taste like hormone infested wings from the Chinese restaurant. No seasoning, no crisp, just plain dry fried meat. They should be ashamed of themselves.

Sans penser au cÃ´tÃ© nutritionnel qui est rouge pour moi ahah on va noter seulement le cÃ´tÃ© plaisir et goÃ»t . Un 5/5 les waffles and chicken tellement bonnes (surtout le poulet) Les quantitÃ©s sont par contre Ã  rÃ©duire et il serait mieux de proposer quelque chose de plus lÃ©ger et de moins sucrÃ© que des parts de gÃ¢teau au maÃ¯s pour faire patienter le client. Personnel poli et accueillant au top . Le restaurant pas loin de Metro ! On a bien mangÃ© !!!!

We tried the waffle with catfish and the smothered chicken with mac and cheese and mashed potatoes at Amy Ruthâ€™s. The food was flavorful and satisfying, and the waitstaff were friendly and attentive.

However, the experience was dampened by an unpleasant smell on the floor, which reminded us of a toilet. It was a bit off-putting and detracted from an otherwise enjoyable meal. They might be doing renovations.
Everything here was delicious, but the catfish was outstanding. Definitely order the catfish!

I didn't know what I could say other than it was amazing. I loved the food here. This place was the highlight of my good experience and it came on a whim. Staff was great, Kool aid was great. We both got "The Ludacris" which was wings, and two sides. Let me tell you, you are getting your money's worth here.

I got the Obama special with baked chicken, collard greens, and Mac and cheese. The baked chicken was so juicy and tender it was practically falling off the bone. Collard greens a little sweet for me but the Mac and cheese was solid â€” not too salty. Definitely want to try their other sides. They gave me complimentary cornbread which was so sweet.

It was vibe  was  there in 25th august on holiday for my nieces 10th birthday to NYC  from London so thought it be good chance to try soul food.
The waitress was so lovely very patient with us given that we hadnâ€™t tried it before well authentic american soul food that is. Forgot her name but sheâ€™s a star

Enjoyed candied yams (uk orange sweet potato basically)  very tasty it was a little bit too sweet for me  but thatâ€™s the points i guess either way it complemented my smothered turkey wings which was full flavour very savoury . I find turkey to be a bit drier than chicken but for me i was able to enjoy so thats a plus.

Sister loves vegetables so enjoyed the Okra

They are not stingy the chef wants to feed you because our plates were full  , you might feel overwhelmed but you wonâ€™t complain  about the portion sizes.
My niece couldnâ€™t finish  her plate , itâ€™s funny coz it looked like she didnâ€™t eat it and unfortunately we couldnâ€™t take it back because we had no microwave at the hotel otherwise that would have got waxed down for breakfast.  Itâ€™s a shame there was no kids menu coz that was a waste of food but thats fine because it seems like a more mature / adult setting .

I did like there interior of seeing influential black people on the walls. Overall great experience , great food. I would come back

Lol love corn bread carried that back to the londonğŸ¤£

After a day of exploring NYC (from Illinois) we found Amy Ruthâ€™s after a quick google search of the best soul food near us. The description held incredibly true. The cornbread was warm and moist, the kind that melts in your mouth. We tried the fried chicken (thigh and leg) and my brother said it was the best fried chicken he has had in his life. The greens and Mac and cheese would be hard to rival, they were both packed full of flavor and perfectly cooked. I was highly impressed with each of our tables meal. We also had help from 2 incredible staff members with a totally unrelated situation, the only way I can describe them is angels! Thank you for your hospitality.

Excellent service, awesome staff! Great vibes in here, beautiful decor, felt so at home. Their house made sweet tea was out of this world! Had the Reggie bush, fried chicken dunked in honey, choice of white or dark meat, I went white. Very juice, very crispy, seasoning was so damn good, and the honey made it perfect! Comes with 2 sides. I had collared greens, first I've ever had and they were out of this world , and the candied yams were delicious! Can't wait to go back. Complimentary corn bread was delicious!

I came here because of the recommendation from a YouTuber.  The fried chicken is REALLY GOOD!!!  The flavor is just right, not too salty at all compared to a lot of fried chicken places.  At first I thought they baked or roasted the chicken before frying it because of the color and the texture inside, but they told me itâ€™s just raw chicken fried.  Very interesting!  Itâ€™s not the juicy kind of fried chicken that Iâ€™m used to, but itâ€™s not dry at all.  And I really enjoyed it with maple syrup â€” this is the first time I eat fried chicken in this way!
The collard greens really amazed me â€” Iâ€™ve never had this kind of flavor before!  Now I understand why I never liked southern American food before I came to Amy Ruthâ€™sâ€¦ itâ€™s only because Iâ€™ve never had such good southern American food before!
Corn bread also tastes pretty interesting.  I guess they put brown sugar in it?
Next time Iâ€™m in NYC I really want to try the chicken and waffle and honey dipped chicken.

ğŸ—ğŸ§‡ Amy Ruthâ€™s lives up to the hypeâ€”again.

This was my second visit, coming back after almost two yearsâ€”and Iâ€™m glad I did. I went for takeout this time, and while the place was busy (as expected), the process was still smooth. There was about a 5â€“10 minute wait to place my order, then another 15â€“20 minutes while it was prepared.

They did forget one item initially, but to their credit, they realized it before I even brought it up. When I walked back in, they acknowledged the miss, apologized, and handed it over immediatelyâ€”no hassle, no attitude. That kind of ownership goes a long way.

I ordered the chicken and waffles (with wings), cornbread, and mac & cheeseâ€”and the food was just as good as I remembered. Flavorful, rich, and distinctâ€”Amy Ruthâ€™s doesnâ€™t taste like any other soul food spot. It has its own identity. The portions were generous, and they packed the takeout bag with care, including utensils and everything I needed.

Itâ€™s not cheap, but you get what you pay for. The quality, flavor, and overall experience make it worth every dollar. Two years later and still hitting. Iâ€™ll be back.

This place is a great soul food restaurant! ğŸ´ Amy Ruth's in Harlem ğŸ—½ serves an wide selection of delicious ğŸ¤¤ dishes ğŸ½ï¸  such as fried chicken ğŸ—, waffles ğŸ§‡, sandwiches ğŸ¥ª, salads ğŸ¥—, and more all named after historic American ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡² figures. Good soul food in Harlem the menu has switched over the years but Im guessing it was to remove unpopular items (pictured chicken wings and pork chops macaroni greens yams and rice and peas) food was HOT and fresh btw

Amy Ruth's is one of Harlem's last treasures. Genuinely southern and delightful. Easily the East Coast version of Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles. Mac, yams and greens are the best sides. The fish is fried to a crisp but they also offer oven-cooked versions. One of the best atmospheres with no embellishments. Great place for a celebration and/or large parties. In addition, the list of beers and wines is at a reasonable price and the starter servings are generousâ€”you can share them. On the whole, the staff is friendly, fun and fabulous. Really glad we could rediscover this place. I can't wait to bring our LA cohorts here. KUDOS to the management for running a tight ship from front to back.

My first time visiting Amy Ruth's.   The service was very good and the server paid attention to detail.   The food came out pretty fast, the cornbread was good.  The other items we ordered were okay,  a little above average.   The prices are not bad for a restaurant in the city.

Iâ€™ve been coming here over 10 years and itâ€™s been a minute with all my travels. As usual they are very consistent and since Iâ€™ve been there last remodeled! Everything comes out super hot, just like it was ordered! The renovations are wonderful and spacious! The service has always been on point. Charmaine served us with a smile and payed attention to detail! Like I said a staple in the community and the best soul food around!

Stopped by here during my second time visiting from Texas.

Overall, the meal was rather disappointing. We ordered The Ludacris. Chicken was fantastic, but the Mac and cheese was overly salted and dry. The potato salad was sweet. The cornbread had decent flavor but was dry.

Very big serving sizes. I split this with my mom; couldnâ€™t imagine eating this all myself! The hand squeezed lemonade was wonderful. Our service was exceptional. Food came out fast.

Loved the various hand painted murals of famous black figures in history. Lots of seating. Also enjoyed the different names of all the food items. Great selection of food to choose from.

I likely wouldnâ€™t return with how disappointing the sides were, would rather try another soul food restaurant honestly.

PROS: Its my first time here at amy ruth, snd the food was AMAZING!!!! From the chicken to the sides.
My husband had the beef ribs bbq and it was perfect!! Not too sweet and the potato
Salad was chunky just like how i want it, the coleslaw was also fresh, cabbage were crunchy and not too sweet ad well, they were all just perfectly seasoned. The chicken wings were also great! And the mac and cheese and thr fried shrimp, the cornbread were so yummy, warm and soft, we also had the banana pudding just a little too sweet to my liking , but basically they were all perfect!!!
(We didnt get the chance to take a photo of the wings and fried shrimp- i think it was just 6-8pcs)

CONS: the service was slow, its pricey for the portion size, yes its delicious but definitely
Pricey. I was disappointed with the leg quarter size, it was definitely too small.
